Action.Name: Menu.Create
Action.Description: Creates a menu table for later use.

Arg.Name: Menu
Arg.Description: The name of the menu to create.

Action.Name: Menu.DoesExist
Action.Description: Determines whether or not a menu exists.

Arg.Name: Menu
Arg.Description: The name of the menu for which to search.

Action.Name: Menu.Enable
Action.Description: Enables or disbales the menu bar.

Arg.Name: Enable
Arg.Description: Whether or not to enable the menu bar.

Action.Name: Menu.GetActive
Action.Description: Gets the name of the currently active menu table.

Action.Name: Menu.GetChecked
Action.Description: Determines whether or not a specifc menu item is checked.

Arg.Name: Menu Item
Arg.Description: The path to the menu item.

Action.Name: Menu.GetEnabled
Action.Description: Determines whether or not a specifc menu item is checked.

Arg.Name: Menu Item
Arg.Description: The path to the menu item.

Action.Name: Menu.GetItemProperties
Action.Description: Gets the properties of a specific menu item.

Arg.Name: Menu Item
Arg.Description: The path to the menu item.

Action.Name: Menu.GetNames
Action.Description: Get the names of all menus.

Action.Name: Menu.GetTable
Action.Description: Gets the specified menu in the format created by Application.GetMenu().

Arg.Name: Menu
Arg.Description: The name of the menu.

Action.Name: Menu.GetXML
Action.Description: Gets the specified menu as an xml table.

Arg.Name: Menu Item
Arg.Description: The path to the menu item.

Action.Name: Menu.LoadFromFile
Action.Description: Loads the xml menu table from a file. If the specified menu does not exist, it will be created, otherwise it will be overwrtitten.

Arg.Name: Menu
Arg.Description: The name of the menu.

Arg.Name: File
Arg.Description: The full path to the menu xml file.

Action.Name: Menu.OnMenu
Action.Description: This must be placed in the On Menu sections of your project in order for this plugin to work.

Arg.Name: e_ID
Arg.Description: This must be left as e_ID.

Action.Name: Menu.RemoveItem
Action.Description: Deletes and item from the specified menu.

Arg.Name: Menu Item
Arg.Description: The path to the menu item.

Arg.Name: AutoUpdate
Arg.Description: Whether or not to auto-update after the action is complete.

Action.Name: Menu.Rename
Action.Description: Renames a menu table.

Arg.Name: Old Name
Arg.Description: The original name of the menu.

Arg.Name: New Name
Arg.Description: The new name ot use.

Action.Name: Menu.RenameItem
Action.Description: Renames a menu item

Arg.Name: Menu Item
Arg.Description: The path to the menu item.

Arg.Name: New Name
Arg.Description: The name to which the item will be renamed.

Arg.Name: AutoUpdate
Arg.Description: Whether or not to auto-update after the action is complete.

Action.Name: Menu.SaveToFile
Action.Description: Save the specified menu xml data to file.

Arg.Name: Menu
Arg.Description: The name of the menu.

Arg.Name: File
Arg.Description: The full path where the xml file will be saved.

Action.Name: Menu.SetActive
Action.Description: Sets the specified menu table to active. If it does not exist, it will be created.

Arg.Name: Menu
Arg.Description: The name of the menu to set active.

Action.Name: Menu.SetChecked
Action.Description: Sets a menu item checked or not.

Arg.Name: Menu Item
Arg.Description: The path to the menu item.

Arg.Name: Checked
Arg.Description: Whether or not the item will be checked.

Arg.Name: AutoUpdate
Arg.Description: Whether or not to auto-update after the action is complete.

Action.Name: Menu.SetDelmiter
Action.Description: Sets the character used to separate menu items in the actions arguments.

Arg.Name: Delimiter
Arg.Description: The character that will become the new delimiter.

Action.Name: Menu.SetEnabled
Action.Description: Sets a menu item enabled or not.

Arg.Name: Menu Item
Arg.Description: The path to the menu item.

Arg.Name: Enabled
Arg.Description: Whether or not the item will be enabled.

Arg.Name: AutoUpdate
Arg.Description: Whether or not to auto-update after the action is complete.

Action.Name: Menu.SetItem
Action.Description: This action is used to create and edit menu items.

Arg.Name: Menu Item
Arg.Description: The path to the menu item.

Arg.Name: Icon ID
Arg.Description: The icon id used for this menu item

Arg.Name: Enabled
Arg.Description: Whether or not the item will be enabled.

Arg.Name: Checked
Arg.Description: Whether or not the item will be checked.

Arg.Name: Code
Arg.Description: The code that will be executed when the menu item is selected.
Arg.Default: "Dialog.Message(\"Test\", \"Well, it seems to be working.\r\nAre you impressed?\", MB_YESNO, MB_ICONQUESTION, MB_DEFBUTTON2);"

EasyMode.Default: "Dialog.Message(\"Test\", \"Well, it seems to be working.\r\nAre you impressed?\", MB_YESNO, MB_ICONQUESTION, MB_DEFBUTTON2);"

Arg.Name: AutoUpdate
Arg.Description: Whether or not to auto-update after the action is complete.

Action.Name: Menu.SetXML
Action.Description: Sets the specified menu from an xml string. If the specified menu does not exist, it will be created, otherwise it will be overwrtitten.

Action.Name: Menu.ToggleChecked
Action.Description: Toggles the checked status of a menu item.

Arg.Name: Menu Item
Arg.Description: The path to the menu item.

Arg.Name: AutoUpdate
Arg.Description: Whether or not to auto-update after the action is complete.

Action.Name: Menu.ToggleEnabled
Action.Description: Toggles the enabled status of a menu item.

Arg.Name: Menu Item
Arg.Description: The path to the menu item.

Arg.Name: AutoUpdate
Arg.Description: Whether or not to auto-update after the action is complete.

Action.Name: Menu.Update
Action.Description: This action is used to refresh the menu bar after changes are made to the active menu.

Action.ReturnValueDescription: Returns 0 if the action was successful. Returns 1 if the menu already exists.
Action.Note: This action is automatically called when the Menu.SetActive() function is called and is, thus, not needed for standard menu operations.

Action.ReturnValueDescription: Returns true if the menu exists and false if it does not.
Returns the name of the active menu. If there is no active menu then a blank strin gis returned.
Returns true if the item is checked and false if it is not. If there is no active menu, -3 is returned.
Returns true if the item is enabled and false if it is not. If there is no active menu, -3 is returned.
Returns the properties of the item in a table indexed by ID, Text, IconID, Checked, and Enabled. If the menu item does not exist then nil is returned. If there is no active menu then -3 is returned.
Returns the names of all menus in a numerically indexed table. If there are no menus then nil is returned.
Action.Note: For most applications one menu will suffice but this is available in case you need to create more than one menu layout.

Action.ReturnValueDescription: Returns the menu table. If the menu does not exist then -1 is returned.
Returns a string containing the menu xml. If the menu does not exist then -1 is returned.
Action.Note: No Menu function will affect any loaded xml documents you may have in memory.

Action.ReturnValueDescription: Returns 0 if the action was successful. Returns -4 if a file error occured (Use Application.GetlastError() to determine the exact problem).
Returns 0 if the action was successful. Returns -3 if there is no active menu.
Returns 0 if the action was successful. Returns 1 if the new menu name references a menu that already exists. Returns -1 if the original menu name references a menu that does not exist.
Returns 0 if the action was successful. Returns -3 if there is no active menu.
Returns 0 if the action was successful. Returns -1 if the menu does not exist. Returns -4 if a file error occured (Use Application.GetlastError() to determine the exact problem).

Action.Note: This function must be called before performing any other menu actions.

Action.ReturnValueDescription: Returns 0 if the action was successful. Returns -3 if there is no active menu.
Returns the menu item delimter. If an invalid character was specified then it is, simply, ignored.
Action.Note: This cannot be any of the following characters: {"\r\n","\\","\'","\"","<",">","="} .

Action.ReturnValueDescription: Returns 0 if the action was successful. Returns -3 if there is no active menu.
Returns 0 if the action was successful. Returns -2 if the item was constructed incorectly. Returns -3 if there is no active menu.
Action.Note: You can use this to create new menu items or change any of the properties of an existing item. To specify a separator, use "---" as the item (e.g. "File|---").

Action.ReturnValueDescription: Returns 0 if the action was successful. Returns -3 if there is no active menu.
Returns 0 if the action was successful. Returns -3 if there is no active menu.
Returns 0 if the action was successful. Returns -3 if there is no active menu.
Action.Note: When using many of the menu altering functions, you can use AutoUpdate and avoid having to use Menu.Update().

Extended.Name: Menu
Extended.Description: The Menu Action Plugin makes creating and manipulating menus a cinch. Forget those exhaustive tables of properties and subtables. With the Menu plugin you'll be on your way to simple menus in no time at all. no more referencing menu items by number. No more miles of code in your On Menu events. This plugin allows you to reference your menu items by name and to specify code based on those name so you never need to remember a menu id again.
Extended.Author: Centauri Soldier
Extended.InstallNotes: Place the Menu folder in your AutoPlay MEdia Studio\Plugins\Actions folder.
